channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Why did Iran shut the Strait of Hormuz, and why does it matter?
How a Norwegian scientist suffered brain damage while trying to debunk Havana syndrome
Who is Randy Fine, the US lawmaker who suggested he’d ‘pick dogs over Muslims’?
Is there ‘no country’ like Vanuatu as Supreme Court says?
After Indus, India to turn off Ravi water tap. Will this leave Pakistan parched this summer?
Jesse Jackson: The American civil rights activist who popularised African American over Black
Macron in India: Strengthening diverse, time-tested India-France ties
item.description: The French President's visit, though coinciding with the AI Summit, will focus on military-industrial cooperation, with France expected to further enhance India’s defence capacities and capabilities

item.title: Bangladesh: Tarique Rahman’s win is a rejection of Yunus’s Islamist vision
item.description: If the Tarique Rahman government governs inclusively, resists ideological extremism, and balances regional relationships wisely, Rahman’s victory may be remembered as the moment Bangladesh reasserted not only its democratic voice but also its strategic self-respect

item.title: Failed marshal, unfailing crisis: How long can Pakistan endure?
item.description: While Pakistan goes through crisis after crisis, ‘failed marshal’ Asim Munir is travelling the globe acting as the finance, foreign, defence and prime minister of Pakistan, all rolled into one

item.title: America rewrites the terms of the transatlantic alliance in Munich
item.description: Munich did not mark the end of the transatlantic alliance. It marked its transformation into a harder, more conditional compact

item.title: Quadro: An illusion or a reality in a fractured world order?
item.description: In an era of geopolitical rupture, a quadrilateral partnership comprising India, Russia, the United States and China remains suspended between possibility and illusion — its future contingent not on rhetoric but on the hard calculus of shared interest, restraint and pragmatic statecraft.

item.title: A strategic reset: Japan Inc bets bigger on India amid global uncertainty
item.description: The 2025 Japan Bank of International Cooperation survey ranked India first for the fourth straight year in manufacturing and, for the second consecutive year, in non-manufacturing, with over 60 per cent of respondents backing it
